page.title: 07POPULATION of GLAMIS
page.content: There are two sizeable settlements in the area. Glamis, population approximately 230, and Charleston with 45 houses occupied and several holiday homes. There are also some 50 people living in scattered farms throughout the area. There are no large families of young children as was common a generation ago. Half of the forty families with children at Glamis School have two children, approximately a quarter have one or three children, and there are only two families with four children. This reflects a continuing trend to two children families. The majority of families still have local roots, but a growing number of families have come into the area, both from the surrounding area and from much further afield.
